intro: Ipomoea lapathifolia subsp. shabensis, commonly known as the Shabean morning glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of flowering vines. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
